subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: keyboard map uploaded
msgSnippet: ... As a programmer, I have no idea whatsoever how to make fonts... but the documentation I have read on the Unicode site suggests that ligatures lie firmly
messageBody:
On 13 Aug 2004, at 06:00, Paige Gabhart wrote:
> Junior QS is fine, but I enjoy being able to also produce computer
> script in senior QS.  Jerome has a problem with the cursor position,
> however.  As a programmer, any idea if this could be corrected without
> tons of trouble?

As a programmer, I have no idea whatsoever how to make fonts... but the
documentation I have read on the Unicode site suggests that ligatures
lie firmly within the realm of font creation, not at the character
encoding level. Thus, I think that only a single Unicode encoding for
Quickscript is necessary for both Junior and Senior Quickscript. The
difference would appear in the font that is used to present them.

> It would seem to me based on your comments and the little I know of
> unicode, that it would make more sense to have a separate coding for
> QS.

Yes, that is the way I am leaning as well. I have downloaded the
relevant proposal documents from the Unicode site, and will fill them
out to the best of my ability. Since getting feedback is an important
part of the Unicode proposal process, I will first post them here along
with any questions I can't easily answer.

oliver
